primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'War of the Lamb': God invades a world occupied by hostile powers to reclaim territory and liberate humanity through the death and resurrection of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: God must obliterate everything that stands against that peace.
He entered a world that was already occupied by a hostile power.
He has cleared a portion of the enemy’s territory.

object.identificatie: Reclamation of creation and the liberation of the 'meek of the earth'.
tekstueel_bewijs: reclaiming a piece of Satan’s territory

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Divine Will
tekstueel_bewijs: God has willed his truth to triumph through us.

ontvanger.identificatie: The poor, the meek, the baptized, and the whole human race.
tekstueel_bewijs: the defenseless of the earth will suddenly find themselves on the winning side.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver/Beneficiary who is subsequently 'enrolled' as a secondary actant.

helper.identificatie: The Word of God, the Spirit, and the Armor of God (which is Christ himself).
tekstueel_bewijs: He slays the enemy with his Word.
He gave us his Spirit. He gave us his weapons.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper (Himself).

tegenstander.identificatie: Satan, the Principalities and Powers, Death, and the 'Hostile Power'.
tekstueel_bewijs: the spiritual hosts of wickedness in the heavenly places
the world rulers of this present darkness
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but a 'malign force' that requires a divine invasion to defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The baptized life: Christians standing as 'beachheads' in enemy territory using God's armor.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Baptized Christian
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Faithful witness and resistance to the Enemy.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is entirely dependent on the primary; the Christian only acts because God has first cleared the territory and provided the armor.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God must obliterate everything that stands against that peace.
He equips you to remain his faithful soldier.
He surrounds you with his strength.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Are you struggling with some secret temptation?
Put on the Lord Jesus Christ.

voorbeelden: We are to depend solely on that Word.
Is there something more that you want to do and be?
knowing what we know about the narrow escape
His power is made perfect in your weakness.
He gives us his weapons... that you may be able to withstand.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the endowment of power (Pouvoir) to an incompetent subject. The hearer is told they cannot fight, but God provides the 'can-do' through His own armor.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (occupied world) through ~S1 (passive acceptance) to ~S2 (the armor/resistance) and finally S1 (the peace of the Lamb).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Right Man' (Christ) who has already won the battle, making the outcome of S1 certain despite the ongoing conflict.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is a cosmic darkness, not a moral lapse.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It consistently identifies God as the primary actor (Subject) and the source of all competence. Human action is framed as a participation in a victory already won by God.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: He has been teaching them that they do not need to continue passively accepting...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: In order to make a new creation, God has to drive out the powers.
The breastplate of righteousness is not your righteousness or mine; it is Christ’s righteousness.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: While human figures like Bishop Ruiz and Todd Beamer are mentioned, they are presented as 'beachheads' where God's power is manifest, not as heroes to be imitated by human effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: they conquered by the blood of the Lamb, not their own courage.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; the burden of the battle is shifted to Christ.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification; God provides the tools for the life He commands.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the cosmic battle (Soteriology) to the personal struggle (Ethics) is seamless because the 'Armor' remains the same in both.
spanning_punten: The paradox of a 'Man of War' who wins by shedding his own blood.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: In his resurrection, the powers of hell have already been overcome.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability) given to the believer.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is an occupying army, not just a mistake; it requires a 'Man of War' to defeat.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a rigorous theocentric structure where God is the Subject of all transformative verbs.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Devoir' (Moralism) trap.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent is already cosmic and terrifying.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The high stakes of the opponent justify the necessity of the Divine Subject.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (The War of the Lamb) → Ethics (Wearing the Armor).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace.' It avoids the instrumentalization of God and keeps the hearer in the position of a grateful recipient of divine power.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'battle' metaphors; Greimas shows that these metaphors function to displace human agency in favor of divine agency.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Isaiah text; semiotics explains how the Isaiah text functions as a 'competence-giver' for the modern hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Armor of God' is not a list of virtues to develop (Moralism) but a set of actantial 'Helpers' provided by the Sender.

volledige_subject_lijst: The Right Man (is on our side)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Armor of God' passage to dismantle self-reliance by redefining each piece of armor as an attribute of Christ rather than a human virtue.
